review: Great product! I don't have a TV enable with LAN/WLAN connection and neither a bluray device with YouTube or something else. I bought Chromecast in order to send Youtube Videos to my TV. Chromecast works perfectly capturing the sound and the video of the Youtube Video and playing it in my TV.Also I downloaded an extension to my Chrome Browser (Laptop) to cast my tabs (only once per time) to my TV.I think soon will be more apps for ChromeCast, now you cannot cast videos from VLC, Quicktime or any of those types of apps.
author: Francisco Pecorella

review: I could reiterate all the positive things from all the other reviews but I'm sure everyone already knows them.  My only caveats are 1) no Amazon Prime Video - Google seriously needs to work this out with amazon....and 2) it doesn't remember how to connect to multiple networks.  So if you should take it with you to another house and plug it in, you'll have to enter the WiFi code on your android device for the new network.  And it will FORGET your old network entirely.  Sadly, it also doesn't allow your android device to TELL the Chromecast what the new WiFi key is.  You'll still have to type it in separately for the Chromecast.
